title: Jobless claims rise to highest level since August; Claims up 9,000 to 228,000 in latest week
text:
Claims have increased in three of the last four weeks. This is the highest level of claims since late August.

Key details: The number of people already collecting jobless benefits rose by 3,000 to 1.368 million.

Big picture: The labor market has been strong and there are reports that firms are "hoarding" workers even as the economy slows But there have been scattered reports this week that big firms like Intel INTC are planning to lay off workers.

Market reaction: Stocks DJIA SPX were set to open sharply lower on Thursday on the back of a surprisingly strong gain in core consumer prices. The yield on the 10-year Treasury note BX:TMUBMUSD10Y jumped close to 4% after the inflation data.

Jobless claims rise to highest level since August
